Based on your preferences for a film noir, I would recommend the following two movies:

1. Sin City (2005) - This film directed by Quentin Tarantino tells the story of Philip (Kunle Remi) and Julia (Yvonne Nelson), a couple high up on the ladder of success and living their dream. Their marriage seems perfect except they can' seem to get to spend time with each other owing to Philips' frequent trips. Finally when they decide to spend time together and go away for a few days, only to find their relationship tested in unexpected ways.

2. The Good German (2006) - Directed by Stephen Daldry, this film tells the story of David (Sam Riley) and his former mistress Lily (Angelina Jolie Pitt). When David returns to Gotham as Batman, he must stop a secret society that intends to destroy the city.

In conclusion, Sin City directed by Quentin Tarantino and The Good German directed by Stephen Daldry both provide excellent film noir experiences.
